alert.note: Alert for Graham; Macon; Swain (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 25 at 4:29AM EDT until March 25 at 4:45AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EDT FOR WESTERN MACON...CENTRAL SWAIN AND EASTERN GRAHAM COUNTIES... At 429 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles east of Gatlinburg to 9 miles east of Andrews, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Robbinsville, Smoky Mountains-Fontana Area, Fontana Lake, Nantahala Lake, Smoky Mountains-Clingmans Dome, Wesser, Stecoah, Kyle, Rainbow Springs and Nantahala. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
